page.title: 02Bondleigh Farming landscape
page.content: Facing N.NW.{Bondleigh}sits in a valley basin of undulating landscape which rises from{100m to 203m}above sea level. Today,{21 farms}in excess of 6ha averaging{54.63ha each,}of a total area of about 1220ha. Within this area are 88.62ha of woodland, mostly hardwood some being of considerable age. Most farms are owner occupied, handed down from parents to sons or daughters. Lowton, family occupied farm, farmed by same family line for over 200 years.{Agricultural} {land;}medium loam,some red soil on South side. Bisected by river Taw fed by small tributaries.{Narrow second } {class roads}give access to farm roads surfaced with tarmac or concrete; some stone tracks still.{Hedges}trimmed short, few still have larger growths of bushes with trees intersperced along them.
